symptoms.name: Blackish small nodules attached to scalp hair
Raspy sensation when hair is pulled between fingers

physical_findings: Multiple discrete firm to hard, brown to black tiny nodules attached to hair shaft
Nodules distributed irregularly along the length of hair shaft
risk_factors: Cultural practices such as tying of veil (especially when done on wet hair)

required: Presence of multiple brown to black oval nodules attached to hair shaft
KOH examination revealing concretion forming a collar around hair shaft made up of filamentous hyphae with spores at edges
Culture growing small, compact, blackish conical colonies with velvety surface
Microscopic examination of colonies showing round, dark brown, globus ascus confirmatory for Piedraia hortae
supportive: Raspy sensation when hair is pulled
